data.text:
@thelittlenomnom Singaporeans are generally well read and in tune. So everybody knows cases are high. 

Restaurants are full, cafes have lines. Retail shops are crowded. If people are voting with action. It's obvious they're voting "I don't care."
@birdyloving Everyone is getting COVID, one way or another, everyone knows it shall be their turn now or sooner, so they stop caring.
@birdyloving wa lao wei, these bodoh people still dont stay 500m away from each other?
@birdyloving MS was a fave of mine as a lad, not sure why but it was
@thepeinster Suntec as well. Millennia walk has got good cafes and restaurants. Marina Square excels at nothing. That’s the problem.
@birdyloving Short walk from there back to City Hall for restaurants lol
@thepeinster Oh yeah. The mix of shops there is not very interesting. I think it’s a fundamental issue. No good restaurants either. It’s traditionally kept afloat by the hotels in the area.
@birdyloving It's confusing as hell to me... Marina Square nice but it's pretty desolate as many shops have shuttered permanently
@thepeinster I rarely go there. Too far for me. Love the size though.
@birdyloving Totally concur. Vivo is packed every day.
